thread.title: Amanda Seyfried can't hide baby bump as she leaves her car | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Amanda Seyfried can't hide baby bump as she leaves her car | Daily Mail Online

author: Bobbie Whiteman For Dailymail.Com
title: Amanda Seyfried can't hide baby bump as she leaves her car | Daily Mail Online
text: Share She teamed them with comfy black joggers and grey Converse sneakers. Amanda's long blonde hair was tucked into her cardigan and she donned a pair of tortoiseshell-rimmed shades to protect her eyes on the cool but bright winter's day. Must be due soon: The 31-year-old Mamma Mia beauty's baby bump is now so large that she couldn't button up her chunky-knit white cardigan She didn't appear to be wearing much make-up aside from pink lipstick. The actress and her actor fiancé Thomas Sadoski, 40, revealed they were expecting their first child back in November. However, they haven't said when the tot is due or whether it's a girl or a boy. Keeping mum: The actress and her actor fiancé Thomas Sadoski, 40, haven't revealed when their first child is due Given that most expectant mothers don't reveal their happy news until after the first trimester, that suggests that baby is due in May - although it's hard to see how Amanda could last that long. Meanwhile, Amanda is continuing to work. She and Thomas will both next be seen in comedy drama The Last Word, co-starring Shirley MacLaine, due out next Friday. Last week Amanda shared a snap of herself pre-baby bump with the 82-year-old star, captioned: 'tbt to #thelastword and it's coming very soon! @bleeckerstfilms.' Getting close: Amanda will next be seen in The Last Word, co-starring Shirley MacLaine, 82, due out next Friday Rolling out: She promoted the comedy drama with this Instagram snap, posted last week that she captioned, 'tbt to #thelastword and it's coming very soon! @bleeckerstfilms' Earlier this month she also shared an Instagram snap of a scene in a house that she captioned: 'Tbt to one week ago. Shot taken as I finished up work on a very special film with the great (director) Paul Schrader. #firstreformed' In the drama, due out next year, she co-stars with Ethan Hawke who plays an ex-military chaplain wracked by grief over the death of his son, She also has an as-yet untitled action dramedy for director Nash Edgerton with Charlize Theron and Thandie Newton in the works plus comedy The Clapper, TV series Twin Peaks, and sci-fi thriller Anon with Clive Owen in post-production. Braving the cold: Amanda and Thomas wrapped up warm as they grabbed warm drinks in a chilly New York earlier this month. The couple announced they were expecting in November Share or comment on this article 155
